# OSSignpostType

**Structure**

The different kinds of signpost.

## Declaration

```swift
struct OSSignpostType
```

## Specifying Signpost Types

- **begin**: A signpost that marks the start of a time interval of interest in your code.
- **end**: A signpost that marks the end of a time interval of interest in your code.
- **event**: A signpost that marks an event in your code.

## Creating Signpost Types

- **init(rawValue:)**: Creates a signpost from a raw integer value.
- **init(_:)**: Creates a signpost from a raw integer value.

## Inspecting Signpost Types

- **rawValue**: An integer value that represents the role of a signpost.

## Measure Events

- **Recording Performance Data**: Add signposts to record interesting time-based events.
- **OSSignposter**: An object for measuring task performance using the unified logging system.
- **Legacy Signpost Symbols**: Migrate your code away from using these legacy symbols.
- **os_signpost_id_t**: An identifier you use to distinguish between signposts that have the same name and destination log.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
